channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Nintendo profit plunges 55% as sales of its ageing Switch console fall sharply
item.description: Nintendo sold 2.1 million units of its flagship Switch consoles, down 46% from the 3.91 million units it sold in the year ago period.

item.title: Why not all semiconductor firms are benefitting from the AI boom like Nvidia has
item.description: Not all chip firms are benefitting from the boom in artificial intelligence, earnings show, underscoring the complexities of the semiconductor supply chain.

item.title: Japan stock sell-off shows a 'fundamental shift' is underway, Goldman Sachs' equity strategist says
item.description: On Friday itself, the Nikkei 225 and the Topix indexes saw their worst days since March 2020, falling more than 5%, according to Factset data.

item.title: Singapore's monetary authority sets up review group in bid to revive its equities market
item.description: MAS said one goal will be to identify methods for encouraging participation, including from capital market intermediaries, investors and listed companies.

item.title: Ice vests, extra breaks and slushies: Olympians are struggling to keep cool in the Paris heat
item.description: U.S. gymnastics superstar Simone Biles isn't the only Olympian feeling the Paris heat.

item.title: Li Auto's July deliveries hit a record as Chinese EV consumers prefer hybrid options
item.description: The strong deliveries reflected Chinese consumers' persistent concerns about relying only on a battery for driving.

item.title: Here's everything you need to know about Friday's big jobs report
item.description: A gradual slowdown in the economy and Hurricane Beryl are expected to have taken some of the steam out of hiring in July.

item.title: China’s first university degree in marriage offers courses like matchmaking and pre-divorce counseling
item.description: Modules will include sociology, wedding venue design, family ethics, the economics of the marriage industry and family policies.

item.title: WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich, ex-Marine Whelan released in U.S., Russia prisoner swap
item.description: The swap of American, Russian and German prisoners is the largest such exchange since the Cold War.

item.title: Age is just a number for this 36-year-old academic who has danced her way to the Olympics
CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Can India's hot deal-making season extend to a free trade agreement?
item.description: India and the U.K. are motivated and see each other benefiting from a deal — but a number of key demands from both stand in the way of a quick agreement.

item.title: Amazon says distraction of Olympics, Trump assassination attempt contributed to weak forecast
item.description: Amazon CFO Brian Olsavsky told reporters after the company's earnings report that "we do see different traffic patterns during those events."

item.title: Intel to cut 15% of workforce, reports quarterly guidance miss
item.description: Intel will say goodbye to 15,000 employees, cut capital expenditures and forgo a fourth-quarter dividend following weak results and quarterly guidance.

item.title: Apple sales rise 5%, topping estimates as iPad and Services revenues jump
item.description: Apple reported earnings after the bell on Thursday.

item.title: Putin's Trader: How Russian hackers stole millions from U.S. investors
item.description: This CNBC documentary is about the rise and fall of Vladislav Klyushin and his business empire. Klyushin was just released from a U.S. prison in a prisoner swap.

item.title: Amazon shares slide on revenue miss, disappointing guidance for third quarter
item.description: Amazon missed on revenue for the second quarter and gave a forecast for the current quarter that fell short of Wall Street's expectations.

item.title: Daily Open: U.S. stocks fall; 10-year Treasury yield drops below 4%; Apple beats Street while Amazon falters
item.description: U.S. stocks fell sharply on Thursday as weaker-than-expected jobs and manufacturing data sparked concerns about a rapid economic slowdown.

item.title: Amazon's cloud unit reports 19% revenue growth, topping estimates
item.description: Amazon Web Services grew sales by 19% in the latest quarter, expanding at a faster rate than its parent company.

item.title: Apple is spending more on AI, but remains far behind its Silicon Valley peers
item.description: Investors are focused on how much mega-cap tech companies are spending on their AI buildouts. Apple is in a category of its own.

item.title: China holds back on more stimulus, citing necessary 'pain'
item.description: China is not planning additional stimulus for the second half of the year, according to officials from the economic planning agency and finance ministry.

item.title: 'Internal battle' in Modi's BJP on whether India needs Chinese investments, Natixis chief Asia economist says
item.description: India has ambitious plans to become a manufacturing powerhouse in Asia, but it might not be able to do so without Chinese investments, experts said.

item.title: Snap shares plunge more than 20% on weak guidance
item.description: Snap issued a forecast for the third quarter that trailed analysts' estimates.

item.title: Here's how much athletes at the Paris Olympics earn for winning medals
item.description: Aside from a medal, a stuffed toy of the Olympics mascot and an official event poster, some medal winners are accorded additional financial rewards.

item.title: Block reports better-than-expected earnings for second quarter
item.description: Block, formerly known as Square, reported better-than-expected earnings for the quarter even as revenue missed estimates.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield falls below 4% for the first time since February
item.description: Treasury yields were steady as investors digested comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who suggested a September rate cut was on the table.

item.title: Israeli military says it killed Hamas armed wing leader Mohammed Deif in Gaza airstrike last month
item.description: Israel's military on Thursday said it killed the chief of Hamas' military wing, Mohammed Deif, in an airstrike in July.

item.title: Wayfair CEO likens home goods slowdown to 2008 financial crisis
item.description: Online home goods company Wayfair has seen sluggish demand against high interest rates, but reprieve could come if the federal reserve cuts rates in September.

item.title: Moderna stock falls 20% as it slashes guidance on low EU sales, tough U.S. vaccine market
item.description: Moderna now expects 2024 product revenue to come in between $3 billion and $3.5 billion, down from a previous guidance of $4 billion.

item.title: Rolls-Royce shares soar to all-time high on reinstated dividend, raised profit guidance
item.description: Shares of Rolls-Royce jumped to an all-time high after the company reinstated its dividend and raised its profit forecast.

item.title: Barclays profit dips in the second quarter, beats estimates
item.description: The British lender is undergoing a major restructuring program in a bid to boost profits.
